qas.question: London was a major factor in the rise of what musical genre?
Musical genres that gained popularity in London and elsewhere, such as dubstep, were based on and derived from what?

answers.text: the foreign genres of hip hop and reggae

qas.question: Which BBC radio station focuses primarily on black and urban music?
What rock music group led by Gavin Rossdale got its start in London's music scene?

context: London was instrumental in the development of <a0_0>punk<a0_0/> music, with figures such as the Sex Pistols, The Clash, and Vivienne Westwood all based in the city. More recent artists to emerge from the London music scene include George Michael, Kate Bush, Seal, Siouxsie and the Banshees, <a3_0>Bush<a3_0/>, the Spice Girls, Jamiroquai, Blur, The Prodigy, Gorillaz, Mumford & Sons, Coldplay, Amy Winehouse, Adele, Ed Sheeran and One Direction. London is also a centre for urban music. In particular the genres UK garage, drum and bass, dubstep and grime evolved in the city from <a1_0>the foreign genres of hip hop and reggae<a1_0/>, alongside local drum and bass. Black music station <a2_0>BBC Radio 1Xtra<a2_0/> was set up to support the rise of home-grown urban music both in London and in the rest of the UK.
